channel.title: How do you put a single quote into a string?
channel.description:
I am trying to build a mysql insert file but I cant get the single quote inserted into the string
this is what I thought would work
[code] s1 := s1 + 'INSERT INTO zips VALUES (' + chr(222) + zipdb[i] + chr(222) + chr(188) + chr(222) + statedb[i]+ chr(222) + ');' + chr(13); [/code]
chr(222); is the chr code for the single quote chr(188) is a comma and chr(13) is enter
but what I get when I open the saved file is...
"INSERT INTO zips VALUES (Þ35006Þ¼ÞAlabamaÞ); " with a little box on the end of the line thou it does start a new line.
it should look like
INSERT INTO zips VALUES ('35006');
I got the values that I'm using from the [FAQ] KeyCodes here at [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,2894.0.html]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,2894.0.html[/url]
is there another chart that I should be using for the quote, the comma and the enter key, or is there a better way to put them in?
Thanks

item.title: How do you put a single quote into a string?

@juslilolme1 wrote:

Thanks a lot guys sorry forgot to mention that I was going on vacation the gold coast was Great If you ever thought about going to Australia Id say do it and do try the dogie (kangaroo), wild boar, and crocodile are all available in the supermarkets.

oh my bad i meant quotation marks, i was just pointing another way to get it to type out for him

Read full topic
item.source: How do you put a single quote into a string?

item.title: How do you put a single quote into a string?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“Creme de la Creme, post:4, topic:273071”]Maybe I’m being ignorant but why can’t you just escape the quote with '?

Then use “\n” for new line. Or it may have been “/n”…[/quote]
try it and it won’t work.

[quote=“FrostFÿr, post:3, topic:273071”]i never knew using two commas made it do that :p, but i use the WriteLn('Hey, I'#39'm FrostF'#255'r'); way.
But using the above way makes the char with that code, not press the key for the code.[/quote]
It’s not 2 commas, it’s 2 single quotation marks next to each other. It works either way, I prefer the simpler way so I do not have to remember that #39 is the code.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you put a single quote into a string?

i never knew using two commas made it do that :p, but i use the WriteLn('Hey, I'#39'm FrostF'#255'r'); way.
But using the above way makes the char with that code, not press the key for the code.

item.source: How do you put a single quote into a string?

item.title: How do you put a single quote into a string?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

To put single quotes in strings just put 2 single quotes next to each other or you can use the character code or the hex code.

begin
  s1 := s1 + 'INSERT INTO zips VALUES ('' + chr(222) + zipdb[i] + chr(222) + chr(188) + chr(222) + statedb[i]+ chr(222) + '');' + chr(13);
end.

or

begin
  WriteLn('won''t, don''t, couldn''t, wouldn''t, shouldn''t, I''m, Tom's truck, sisters'' car');
end.

~Ron

Read full topic
item.source: How do you put a single quote into a string?

item.title: How do you put a single quote into a string?
item.dc:creator: @juslilolme1 juslilolme1
item.description:
@juslilolme1 wrote:

I am trying to build a mysql insert file but I cant get the single quote inserted into the string

this is what I thought would work

s1 := s1 + 'INSERT INTO zips VALUES (' + chr(222) + zipdb[i] + chr(222) + chr(188) + chr(222) + statedb[i]+ chr(222) + ');' + chr(13);

chr(222); is the chr code for the single quote
chr(188) is a comma
and chr(13) is enter

but what I get when I open the saved file is…

"INSERT INTO zips VALUES (Þ35006Þ¼ÞAlabamaÞ); " with a little box on the end of the line thou it does start a new line.

it should look like

INSERT INTO zips VALUES (‘35006’);

I got the values that I’m using from the [FAQ] KeyCodes here at http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,2894.0.html

is there another chart that I should be using for the quote, the comma and the enter key, or is there a better way to put them in?

Thanks
